intro: Tragacantha frutescens, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a milky sap, which is used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important species in dryland ecosystems. Its resilience to drought and poor soil conditions contributes to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
